info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 8:07PM CDT until June 14 at 11:40AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Salado Creek At at Loop 13 affecting Bexar County.
San Antonio River Near Elmendorf affecting Bexar and Wilson Counties.
San Antonio River near Floresville affecting Karnes and Wilson Counties.
Medina River At Hwy 281 affecting Bexar County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Leon Creek At I-35S near San Antonio affecting Bexar County.
Cibolo Creek at Sutherland Springs affecting Karnes and Wilson Counties.
Cibolo Creek Near Falls City affecting Karnes County.
Medina River at Somerset affecting Bexar County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cibolo Creek near Falls City.
* WHEN...From Friday afternoon to late Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding of crop and pastureland damages irrigation pumps and any equipment near the channel. Livestock are cut off in low areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 2.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.6 feet on 05/16/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING
